This has always been the case for me in my writing. The ideas that won't go away are the ones I know I have to pursue, if nothing else, just to get them out of my head.

#filmquotes #FilmTwitter #Filmmaking #WritingCommunity https://t.co/93AartyEDj

One of the cinematic images that has stuck with me from the slate of 2021 films, is that of the 3 Witches in Joel Coen's "The Tragedy of Macbeth," beautifully shot by Bruno Delbonnel. What are some images that had a lasting impact on you in 2021? 

#cinematography https://t.co/F7IM2cJru3

To me, the most important word in filmmaking and in life is "action." Big or small, what projects are you taking action on today? 

#Hustle #Filmmaking #FilmmakingTips https://t.co/6Q1CZOI0j4

For those of you who don't know, I am a filmmaking coach. I'm giving away one month of free film coaching to one person. If you're interested in learning more, comment below or send me a DM and let's chat!

#FilmmakingTips #Filmmaking #Filmmaking101 https://t.co/H4ZATuLFPb

It's #Oscar Sunday! Here are my top 10 films of 2021 (not necessarily in order).

What was your favorite film of 2021?
